required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: One Key Question: Pilot Study at NorthShore
clinical_study.official_title: One Key Question-System Team Patient: A Pilot Study Phase II

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a pilot assessment of whether practices that implement the One Key Question® (OKQ) pregnancy intention screening tool will demonstrate differences in patient-reported receipt of preconception and/or contraceptive counseling, compared to practices that provide usual care. The study team surveyed patients at six practices within NorthShore University HealthSystem to establish baseline rates of counseling. To assess OKQ's effects on patient care, this pilot study will expose half of the practices to the OKQ tool. After these practices implement OKQ, patients will be surveyed at both intervention and control (usual care) practices to measure changes in preconception and contraceptive care.

detailed_description.textblock:
Effectively delivered preconception counseling leads to healthier pregnancy behaviors. However, many clinicians miss opportunities to provide this counseling due to a lack of processes in place to provide this counseling and access to evidence based care once the need is identified. The purpose of this study is to build upon baseline data collected on pregnancy intention and receipt of contraceptive and preconception counseling.
Half of the study practices that have already been surveyed will be randomly selected to receive comprehensive One Key Question® Training through the nonprofit Power To Decide. These practices have already displayed interest in taking part in this intervention.The training will act as our intervention, and will be given to help improve the quality of preconception and contraceptive counseling in Primary Care and Obstetrics/Gynecology. All of the participating practices will then be surveyed again to determine changes in contraception and preconception counseling. After patient data collection is complete, the research assistant will return to each practice to collect surveys from clinicians and staff (this includes: physicians, nurses, medical assistants, patient support associates, or anyone that participated in the OKQ training) at the intervention practices to assess the experience of implementing OKQ and their perceptions of its utility for patients. Following the second round of surveys, the remaining practices will receive Power To Decide training.

primary_outcome.measure: Receipt of Any Reproductive Health Counseling
primary_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Among patients with potential to become pregnant, percent of respondents who received any reproductive health counseling. Counts as "Yes" for this outcome if they received any contraceptive counseling or any preconception counseling.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Among patients with potential to become pregnant, percent of respondents who received any contraceptive counseling.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Among patients with potential to become pregnant, percent of respondents who received any preconception counseling.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Among patients with potential to become pregnant, percent of respondents who currently use any most or moderately effective contraception method

secondary_outcome.measure: Current Use of a Most or Moderately Effective Contraception Method
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Among patients with potential to become pregnant, percent of respondents who currently use any contraception method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Among patients with potential to become pregnant, percent of respondents who mark "no" or "unsure" to One Key Question and not using most or moderately effective contraception

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Among patients with potential to get pregnant, percent of respondents who mark "yes", "unsure", or "ok either way," and not on folic acid or using most effective contraception

other_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
other_outcome.description: Distribution of patient responses (extremely satisfied, very satisfied, satisfied, very dissatisfied, extremely dissatisfied) when asked about satisfaction with overall medical care during today's visit

other_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
other_outcome.description: Distribution of patient responses (extremely satisfied, very satisfied, satisfied, very dissatisfied, extremely dissatisfied) when asked about satisfaction with the way their provider talked with them about improving their health

other_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
other_outcome.description: Patients not having undergone menopause or sterilizing surgery

other_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
other_outcome.description: Percent of patients answering yes, no, okay either way, and unsure to whether they would like to become pregnant in the next year

other_outcome.time_frame: After the clinic has implemented OKQ for at least 4 weeks
other_outcome.description: Distribution of patient scores on the Desire to Avoid Pregnancy scale (a 14-item validated measure of pregnancy intention)

arm_group.description: These clinics, including physicians, clinical and administrative staff, will receive the One Key Question training program, delivered by Power to Decide, via an in-person group training session.
These clinics will not receive the OKQ training program during the study period. They will have the opportunity to receive the training after the study period is over.

intervention.description: The OKQ training program helps clinicians more efficiently meet the needs of women's pregnancy intentions and provide evidence-based care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- 18-49 years old
- Receiving either primary or obstetric/gynecology care at one of the study clinics
Exclusion Criteria:
- Male
- Pregnant
- <18 years old >49 years old

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
